attributes.action: Request a general election to allow for a new popular mandate
attributes.additional_details: According to the latest available information (accurate to the end of 2014) there are just 149,800 Conservative party members. This represents just 0.32% of the total UK electorate (46,499,537 as recorded in June 2016 for the European Union Referendum). We believe that the new Prime Minister should receive a mandate from the people and not a small section of people who belong to the same party as the Prime Minister.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call on the Prime Minister (when they are elected at the beginning of September) to call a general election and allow themselves to be elected by the people of the United Kingdom not just Conservative party members
